meta_description: A contemporary art museum in downtown San José.
hours_text:
_Masako Miki: Night Parade of One Hundred Demons_ 2022\. Courtesy of the Artist and Cult Aimee Friberg.

Image credits: Impart Photography

# Visit

# The ICA is open Thurs-Sun, 12-5PM.

The ICA is open Thursday-Sunday, 12-5pm.

## The ICA is located at 560 South First Street, San José, CA 95113. ​  
Admission is always free.

## **Driving**

The ICA San José is located at 560 South First Street. The nearest cross streets are Reed and William Street. Metered street parking is available on South First Street (meters operate until 6PM). There is also a parking lot underneath Hwy 280 one block south of the ICA and that is $5 all day.

## Public transportation

### From San Francisco/ Peninsula:

  1. Take Southbound CalTrain to San José Diridon station.
  2. At Diridon, you can take various busses to the ICA. You can take: 
     * The free shuttle (the 201 Dash) to South 2nd and San Carlos and walk three short blocks to down South 1st Street
     * The 68 bus to 2nd and William and walk two short blocks down East Williams Street and South 1st Street
     * The 902 VTA Light Rail to the Convention Center Station and walk eight minutes southwest down South Market Street to South 1st Street
  3. The ICA will be on your left.

### From Oakland/ East Bay:

  1. Take Westbound Capital Corridor (Amtrak) to San José Diridon
  2. At Diridon, you can take various busses to the ICA. You can take: 
     * The free shuttle (the 201 Dash) to South 2nd and San Carlos and walk three short block...

## Volunteer

## VOLUNTEER

Would you like to volunteer for future events or workshops? Email a staff member and get started!

## Join Us

## Join Us

If you’d like to support the ICA, consider joining as a member or becoming part of our board. Visit the Member tab to explore the benefits of joining our family.
